thread.title: County Rainstorm to Cause Power Outages
thread.title_full: County Rainstorm to Cause Power Outages

author: @wagmnews
title: County Rainstorm to Cause Power Outages
text:
County Rainstorm to Cause Power Outages By Karri Triplett Published: Dec. 12, 2024 at 5:41 PM EST | Updated: 21 hours ago Email This Link
Share on Facebook
Share on X (formerly Twitter)
Share on Pinterest
Share on LinkedIn
PRESQUE ISLE, Maine (WAGM) - Locals are preparing for the impact of a December rainstorm. With high winds predicted to start Wednesday night and continue on into Thursday morning. Versant Power is expecting the storm to affect customers all across their service territory. They say customers should expect the possibility of outages Thursday morning.
Marissa Minor, a Communications Supervisor at Versant Power says, “We are predicting widespread outages throughout our entire service territory, so we’ve stocked up on crews. We have external contractors coming to help that are both local and also from across the border in Canada, so we’re fully staffed and ready to respond. We have additional people at the call center ready to take your calls in case your power goes out as well. We are asking customers to prepare for a multi-day restoration spanning several days and that means you should really have your flashlights out ready to go if the power goes out a fresh supply of water some food and make sure you charge your cellphones and other devices.”
Versant says to report an outage use the live outage tool on versantpower.com or call them at 973-2000. Locals are asked to please not call 911 unless there is a true emergency.
